channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FIRST RESPONDER WAS PAGED TO LOCATION OF SPILL, HE DONNED APPROPRIATE PPE AND ARRIVED ON SCENE WHERE HE FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND PROPER RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP AND CONTAIN THE SPILL AND AFFECTED MATERIAL, WHICH WAS THEN BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER PROCESSING AND DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report E-2024010447
item.description:
Report E-2024010447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCO experienced a UN3264 Kroff KR-B3020 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 20’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Sodium bicarb and absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into an 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010438
item.description:
Report E-2024010438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 17, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3262 was torn in transit and released approximately twenty-five (25) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. ER personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the powder-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums staged at the terminal for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120457
item.description:
Report E-2023120457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ERTS was contacted about a spill that occurred on the dock. The spill consists of (1) 55-gallon metal drum containing Chemlok 205 adhesive liquid, which was punctured by a forklift during dock ops, causing approximately 15 gallons to release from the container. No Drains, Soils or waterways were impacted.
